offlabel-antrag.title: Off-label application
offlabel-antrag.description: Capture an off-label application with core data and request details for insurer and doctor.

offlabel-antrag.export.defaults.noSeveri: No dedicated severity values are currently documented.
offlabel-antrag.export.defaults.medicati: Please select a medication from the list to include the medication-specific rationale block.
offlabel-antrag.export.severity.bell: My functional level is Bell score {{bellScore}}.
offlabel-antrag.export.severity.gdb: A disability degree (GdB) of {{gdb}} is documented{{marker}}.
offlabel-antrag.export.severity.pflegegr: A nursing care level of {{pflegegrad}} is in place.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.subject: Application for cost coverage (off-label use): {{drug}}
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p1: I hereby request cost coverage / authorization of a prescribed off-label use of {{drugName}} ({{drugSubstance}}) for symptoms related to {{diagnosisMain}}.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p2: The disease causes a sustained and substantial impairment in quality of life and daily functioning. {{severitySummary}} (Supporting documents are listed in the attachments.)
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p3: There is currently no generally accepted causal standard therapy for {{diagnosisMain}}; routine care is mainly symptom-oriented.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p4: Based on off-label appraisal criteria (serious disease, no standard treatment alternative, indication-based evidence of benefit with acceptable risk), I kindly request a positive individual decision.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p5: Section 2(1a) SGB V should also be considered where a comparably severe disease exists and no standard benefit is available. Relevant case law has treated severe ME/CFS as a meaningful basis in this context.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p6: Previously attempted/exhausted treatment approaches (excerpt): {{triedTreatments}} Sustainable symptom control could not be achieved, or measures were not tolerated.
offlabel-antrag.export.part1.p9: I kindly request a timely written decision (appealable formal notice). I am available for follow-up questions or additional documents.
offlabel-antrag.export.medication.agomel: BfArM evaluates agomelatine in the long/post-COVID context and explicitly references fatigue in post-infectious ME/CFS.

The treatment goal is a meaningful improvement in {{targetSymptoms}}, especially fatigue and sleep-wake regulation. Planned use: 25 mg in the evening with an optional increase to 50 mg after medical review.
Safety and monitoring include liver function checks according to product information, contraindications, and interaction checks.
offlabel-antrag.export.medication.ivabra: BfArM evaluates ivabradine for long/post-COVID associated PoTS in adults, especially when beta blockers are not tolerated or not appropriate.

The treatment goal is reduced orthostatic tachycardia and a meaningful improvement in {{targetSymptoms}} in {{diagnosisPots}}. Planned use: gradual titration (e.g. 2.5 mg twice daily) with clinical adjustments.
Safety and monitoring include pulse/blood pressure, ECG where indicated, and review of contraindications and interactions.
offlabel-antrag.export.medication.vortio: BfArM evaluates vortioxetine in the long/post-COVID context for cognitive impairment and/or depressive symptoms.

The treatment goal is a meaningful improvement in {{targetSymptoms}}, especially cognitive impairment (brain fog) and/or depressive symptoms. Planned use: gradual dosing (e.g. 5 mg daily start) with benefit evaluation after around 12 weeks.
Safety and monitoring include adverse effects, contraindications, interactions, and close medical follow-up; local market availability should be considered.
offlabel-antrag.export.part2.subject: Cover letter for off-label application (part 1) - request for support
offlabel-antrag.export.part2.p1: Please find attached my insurer letter (part 1: off-label cost coverage request). I kindly ask for your support so the request is medically clear and decision-ready.
offlabel-antrag.export.part2.p2: A short medical note (1-2 paragraphs) referring to part 1 would be particularly helpful:
offlabel-antrag.export.part2.supportBull: - prior treatment attempts and why no adequate standard option exists
- planned dosing, monitoring, and benefit-risk assessment
- where relevant, why waiting may lead to significant deterioration
offlabel-antrag.export.part2.p3: If you support the request, an optional signature/confirmation in the insurer letter (part 1) can be helpful.
offlabel-antrag.export.sources.item1: MD Bund, appraisal guideline "Hinweise zum Off-Label-Use", status 2024-06-24.
offlabel-antrag.export.sources.item2: BfArM, expert group long-COVID off-label use: agomelatine assessment (status 2025-10-15).
offlabel-antrag.export.sources.item3: BfArM, expert group long-COVID off-label use: ivabradine assessment (status 2025-10-15).
offlabel-antrag.export.sources.item4: BfArM, expert group long-COVID off-label use: vortioxetine assessment (status 2025-10-15).
offlabel-antrag.export.sources.item5: LSG Niedersachsen-Bremen, interim decision on ME/CFS and Section 2(1a) SGB V.
